markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

postbulletin.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website for the Post-Bulletin, a five-days-a-week newspaper covering Rochester, Minnesota, and the surrounding region in the southeastern part of the state.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Post-Bulletin is owned by the Small Newspaper Group, a privately held, Kankakee, Illinois-based media company. The company also owns Rochester Magazine and the Daily Journal in Kankakee, Illinois.

Postbulletin.com generates revenue through advertisements and subscriptions for the print and online publications.

Content

The website covers government, politics, business, culture, and sports in Rochester, Minnesota, and several surrounding counties. Typical coverage has included a feature about dairy farmers leaving the business because of the long hours and dwindling profits; a report on a local port authority getting a state grant to fix a dock; and an article about a Rochester man charged with assaulting two court deputies. There is also regular coverage of the Mayo Clinic, the renowned healthcare network that is headquartered in Rochester.

The site also features a Heard on the Street section with announcements about community events, restaurant openings, and other civic news. Other sections focus on local history and the agriculture industry.

Postbulletin.com publishes state, national, and international news from The Associated Press.

Credibility

Articles are generally balanced and well-sourced, citing police, government officials, people with firsthand knowledge of events, and subject-matter experts. Headlines accurately reflect content.

The site has a dedicated opinion section, featuring editorials, op-ed columns, and letters to the editor.

Postbulletin.com does not post a corrections policy, but it regularly publishes corrections in the form of stand-alone notes that explain the error.

Transparency

Stories include authors’ names and email addresses, with a link to their biographies. A Contact Us page gives phone and email information for the Post-Bulletin’s leadership. Another page, the Newsroom Directory, provides names, photos, and contact information for the reporting and editing staff.

A history page discloses ownership details. Advertisements are distinguishable from editorial content.

History

The newspaper’s predecessor, The Rochester Daily Bulletin, was founded in 1916. Len H. and Jean Alice Shaver Small, owners of the Small Newspaper Group in Kankakee, Illinois, bought the newspaper in 1977.

Written by:
Jennie Kamin

Edited by:
Peggy Ackermann Eric Effron
